titleStmt.title: Albert W. Adams to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2066

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency,
Thomas E. Bramlette,
Governor of Kentucky.
Sir,

The undersigned respectfully solicits of you the appointment of Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky, and would represent that he is a Notary Public and Justice of the Peace for the County of Suffolk, State of Massachusetts, as also Commissioner for several of the States and Territories, to which business his entire attention is devoted.
Hon. Oliver Warner, Secretary of State of the State of Massachusetts, informs me that he has this day fowarded to you, from his office, a letter recommendatory.
Any further certificate or reccommendations which you may require will with pleasure be furnished.

Awaiting your favorable consideration.
I remain Sir,
Your obedient Servant,
Albert W. Adams.
Boston March 27th 1865.

Comr Deeds
Massachusetts
comd
Albert W. Adams
31st Mch 1865
